snippet: Romania’s foreign minister, Teodor Melescanu, resigned Tuesday, barely a week after taking office, after thousands of citizens living outside the country were unable to vote in last weekend’s presidential runoff election.
abstract: Romanian Foreign Min Teodor Melescanu resigns after having served only one week, after thousands of citizens living outside the country were unable to vote in presidential runoff elections; issue is seen as key part of Klaus Iohannis's victory over Prime Min Victor Ponta.
lead_paragraph: Romania’s foreign minister, Teodor Melescanu, resigned Tuesday, barely a week after taking office, after thousands of citizens living outside the country were unable to vote in last weekend’s presidential runoff election.
